article.name: Branded Landing Pages, Training Notifications, and Email Templates Guide
article.title: Branded Landing Pages, Training Notifications, and Email Templates Guide
article.body:
In the KSAT console, we have system landing pages, training notifications, and phishing email templates with a built-in placeholder used to display your company logo. Branded landing pages and email templates are indicated with a (Branded) label in their titles, and training notifications are labeled with (Logo) in their titles.

In order for your company logo to display in our built-in phishing templates, landing pages, and training notifications, you must add a publicly available URL of your company logo to your Account Settings. Visit our How Do I Add My Company Logo and URL to the Console? article for more information.

Creating Branded Landing Pages, Training Notifications, and Email Templates

To create your own branded landing page, training notification, or email template, you can use built-in placeholders inside the What You See Is What You Get (WYSIWYG) editor. Read the sections below to learn more about incorporating your company logo and brand color with these placeholders.

Incorporating Your Company Logo

You can incorporate your company logo by adding the Company Logo URL placeholder. This will add a placeholder that will automatically populate your company logo into the specific landing page, training notification, or email template you are creating.

To incorporate your company logo, follow the steps below:

  1. Ensure you've added your company logo URL to your Account Settings.
  2. Navigate to the desired landing page, notification, or template and click its name.
  3. In the WYSIWYG editor, click on the Placeholder drop-down menu.
  4. Select the Company Logo URL placeholder.
  5. After adding the placeholder, Click Save.
  6. Enable the Show Remote Images option when you preview your template to make sure your logo is displaying correctly.

Incorporating Your Brand Color

In any saved landing page, training notification, or email template, you can replace any color with your organization's unique brand color by using the [[brand_color]] placeholder within the source code. This placeholder automatically populates the hex code of your organization's brand color, as it was set in Account Settings. Follow the steps below to use this feature.

Important: This placeholder should only be used within the source code of a landing page, notification, or template.
  1. Ensure a brand color has been set in your Account Settings.
  2. Navigate to the desired landing page, notification, or template and click its name.
  3. From the WYSIWYG editor, click on the Source button.
  4. Find the RGB or HEX color you would like to change.
  5. Replace the color code with the [[brand_color]] placeholder. Because you cannot access the WYSIWYG menu from the source view, we recommend typing this placeholder manually or copying and pasting it into the source code.
  6. After adding your brand color, click Save.

images.alt:
The image displays a formal, text-based digital notification, likely an excerpt from an email or internal web portal, concerning an annual Expense Reimbursement certification and compliance requirement.

**Textual Content:**
1.  **Header:** Bold text reads "Greetings,".
2.  **Body Text:** Policy text informs the recipient of an "Expense Reimbursement certification" that occurs annually. It details eligibility, highlighting the capitalized phrase "EMPLOYEE EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT."
3.  **Call to Action (Pre-CTA Text):** The final line of instruction reads: "Kindly CLICK BELOW to review and approve the compliance section so we can proceed."

**UI Elements:**
1.  **Button:** A primary, centralized Call to Action (CTA) button is rendered with a dark blue background and slightly rounded corners.
2.  **Button Label:** The text within the button is white, all capital letters, and reads: "CLICK HERE TO REVIEW."
3.  **User Indicator:** A standard black, angled mouse pointer (cursor icon) is visible to the immediate right of the CTA button, indicating readiness for user interaction.

**Context:** The document requires the user to click the interactive element to proceed with reviewing and approving a mandated compliance section.
